p: Iodine value was determined according to the method recommended by AOAC [ 13]. Oil (0.2 g) was taken in 100 mL glass stoppered bottle and dissolved in 15 mL of carbon tetrachloride solution. After addition of 25 mL Wij’s reagent, the contents in the flask were allowed to stand in dark at 25°C for 2 h and then 20 mL of potassium iodide (10%) was added and titrated with sodium thiosulphate (0.2 N) using starch as indicator. The iodine value was calculated using a blank prepared in a similar manner.
